projectPurpose: To provide a fast, efficient, and multiprotocol open-source tool for security professionals to perform credentials bruteforcing, password spraying, and enumeration against various network services as part of security assessments and penetration testing.
mainFeatures: Multiprotocol support (including AMQP, Cassandra, HTTP, Kerberos, LDAP, MongoDB, MQTT, SQL, SSH, Telnet, VNC, etc.)
High performance and resource efficiency via Rust and Tokio
Advanced HTTP features (NTLM, forms, CSRF, enumeration)
TCP and UDP port scanning with banner grabbing

alternatives.name: Medusa
mainFeatures: Flexible user input for targets and credentials
Supports various protocols (SSH, FTP, HTTP, RDP, SMB, etc.)

alternatives.name: Ncrack
mainFeatures: Supports protocols like SSH, RDP, HTTP(S), SMB, VNC, FTP, Telnet

alternatives.name: Patator
mainFeatures: Supports a wide range of protocols (FTP, SSH, SMTP, SQL, HTTP, etc.)

alternatives.name: NetExec (formerly CrackMapExec)
mainFeatures: Enumeration of shares, sessions, users, etc.
Password spraying against SMB, LDAP, etc.
Module support for various tasks (e.g., dumping hashes)

marketPositioning: Legba positions itself as a modern, high-performance, and resource-efficient multiprotocol credentials testing tool built with Rust and an asynchronous runtime. It aims to compete with established tools like THC-Hydra and Medusa by offering a wide range of protocol support combined with superior speed and lower resource consumption, as demonstrated by its benchmarks. Its comprehensive feature set, including detailed HTTP options and enumeration capabilities, makes it a versatile choice for contemporary network security assessments, appealing to users seeking a faster and more efficient alternative in the crowded space of network penetration testing tools.
